lines.text: You can't beat me on the grade. You can't beat me on the grade!
I'd like to report a truck driver who's been endangering my life.
Fill it with Ethel.
As long as Ethel doesn't mind.

[discussing an amateur talent competition]
So, what is it that you do, if I may ask?
I play meat.
You play meat?
Yes, uh... meat. You know, beef, pork...

[laughing]
That's sick, man. That's sick.
Come on you miserable fat-head, get that fat-ass truck outta my way!
Do you have a men's room?
Yeah. Through the door, ON THE RIGHT! Down the hall. Take a left. Second door.

[after the truck smashes the phone booth]
Lady, you have got to call the police!
With what? That's the only phone I got!

[after the truck begins destroying Sally's Snakearama]
Why'd he do that? Why'd he break my cages?
Don't... don't... don't sit on the hood. That hood will dent. I told the kids not to get on the hood! Just see if you can bounce it loose, and I'll... ah... just bounce it loose.
Well it's about time, Charlie!
Where's the summit? Please... please... COME OOOOON!

[to David Mann]
Take a look at my snakes if you have time.

[after the truck smashes the cages]
My snakes! I've gotta find my snakes!
[first lines]
[radio playing, driving down the road, approaches the truck]
[David coughs, coughs again]
Talk about pollution.
How can he go so fast?
There you are, right back in the jungle again.
Come on, car! COME ON, LET'S GO!
That truck driver's crazy, he's been trying to kill me, I mean it!
Well, mister, if I was to vote on who's crazy around here, it'd be you.

[David Mann mistakenly thinks that the man eating a sandwich in the cafe is the truck driver harassing him]
Look, uh... I want you to cut it out.

[bites into sandwich, chewing]
Wha?
Just... just cut it out, okay?

[bites into sandwich again, chewing]
Cut what out?
Now come on, let's uh... let's not play games.
What the hell you talkin' about?
I can call the police.

[stops eating, looks suprised]
Police?

You think that I won't? You're wrong, mister. I mean if you think you can just... just take that... that truck of yours and use it as a murder weapon and uh... killin' people on the highway... you're wrong! You got another thing comin'!

[shakes head, fed up]
Man, you need help.

[Mann slaps the sandwich out of his hand]
Don't you tell me I need *help*!
[punches Mann in the stomach]

[piercing, nasal voice]
Heeeeeey!

[as David Mann exits cafe restroom and enters dining area]
Are you all right?
Yeah, I'm fine.
What happened out there?
Oh, just a slight complication.
Oh? Looked like a big complication to me!
[Cafe patrons laugh. Mann gives an irritated look]

[after David Mann's car crashes into a fence]
You all right, Mister?

[meekly]
Yeah. Yeah, except - Oh, my neck.
Looks like you could use a new radiator hose.

[muttering to himself]
Yeah, where have I heard that before?
[to the attendant]
I'll get one later, thanks.
You're the boss.
Not in *my* house, I'm not.

[while talking on phone]
No, that's *two* Ns!

[When the truck lets him pass it]
It's about time, Charlie!
Great. I'm never goona make it to that appointment now!

[Valiant hidden from passing trucker - camera slowly travels up hood to worn, weary David Mann]
The highway's all yours Jack... I'm not budging for at least an hour. Maybe the police will pull you in by then... maybe they won't... but at least you'll be far away from me...

[Mann sarcastically imitating wife's voice]
Well dear, did you have a nice trip?
[Mann responding]
Uh, no, no... Just the... just the same old thing... o-boy, o-boy, o-boy...
